name: Mason Drama Club
description: Our club puts on the extra-curricular theater productions at Mason High School.  We do three shows a year, two plays in the fall and winter, and a musical in the spring.  We have over 200 students who participate each year, and positions for both actors and theater technicians.

name: Spanish National Honor Society
description: The purpose of this organization is to recognize high school scholastic achievement in the study of Spanish and to promote interest in the study of the Spanish language and Hispanic/Spanish culture.

name: Science National Honors Society
description: A science-based honors society based upon character, leadership, and service. Through guest speakers and enrichment sessions, we enrich our Mason community with scientific opportunities. We serve as scientific leaders serving to help our peers foster and develop a passion for science. Within the club, we offer opportunities for our members to engage in team-based experiments and design challenges through our monthly meetings.
additionalName: Science National Honors Society Leadership Team

name: National Art Honor Society
description: The National Art Honor Society (NAHS) was founded in 1978 to inspire and recognize scholarship and art in the development of creativity, character, service and leadership. NAHS strives to aid members in working toward the attainment of the highest standards in art areas, and to bring art education to the attention of the school and community.  Membership in NAHS is both an honor and a commitment.

name: ASL Club / ASL Honor Society
description: For those interested in taking ASL who couldn't get into the class to learn about ASL and Deaf culture / community. Those that are ASL Honor Society members will participate in club and Honor Society hour fulfillment will be discussed

name: Tabletop Gaming Club
description: A club for students who are interested in board games, card games, roleplaying games, or anything else played on a Tabletop. Meetings are after school on Tuesdays until 4:15 pm, in Room A313. A $15 participation fee is due by your 3rd attended meeting.

name: Red Cross
description: Red Cross is  a service oriented club that is an extension of the American Red Cross.  We work to do different service projects to benefit the American Red Cross's lines of service, as well as to help our community.

name: National Honor Society
description: The National Honor Society was established in 1921 to recognize outstanding high school students. More than just an honor roll, it serves to honor those students who have demonstrated excellence in the areas of Scholarship, Leadership, Service, and Character. Chapter membership challenges members to develop further through active involvement in school activities and community service.

name: HOSA
description: HOSA is a global student-led organization recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human Services and several federal and state agencies. HOSA’s mission is to empower HOSA-Future Health Professionals to become leaders in the global health community, through education, collaboration, and experience. HOSA actively promotes career opportunities in the health industry and to enhance the delivery of quality health care to all people. HOSA provides a unique program of leadership development, motivation, and recognition exclusively for students enrolled in health science education and biomedical science programs or have interests in pursuing careers in health professions. HOSA is 100% health care!

name: Ice Hockey
description: We are an OHSAA sanctioned athletic team that competes with other high schools in the state. We offer options for both JV and Varsity teams and have a mix of experienced and beginner players. Whether you have been playing your whole life, or just want to get started, we would love to have you.

name: MHS Ski Club
description: We are a High School club that wants to share a passion for the sport of skiing and snowboarding. Our mission is to create a fun and safe skiing experience for our school community. We travel to Perfect North 4 times in the winter season, but also meet outside these ski trips for other school and community events. Spots are limited and are filled via a lottery.
sectionOneContent:
Registration for the club takes place in September/October. Our club numbers are limited to how many seats are available on the coach bus that we take to Perfect North Slopes (4 times each season).  When seats become available each year, there is a lottery for all students interested which closes on October 1st. The registration period will conclude once all seats are filled and the club will no longer be accepting new members at that point in time. 
 
For students who don't "hit the lottery" all hope is not lost as they will then be placed on the waitlist, which is typically active each year as some current club members can no longer participate for various reasons. The order of the waitlist is determined by when they submitted their interest to the club lottery! Here is a link to next year’s lottery/waitlist: Ski Club Lottery 2022-2023.
 
There is a club fee of $165 which covers transportation, staff, end-of-the-year pizza party, and club shirt which is paid directly to MHS. Students will also need to purchase a pass that fits their needs through Perfect North Slopes. Directions on purchasing a pass through the club will be provided once the registration process is completed. Rental gear and lessons are also available through Perfect North Slopes depending on individual needs.

name: International Club
description: International Club is a globally-oriented organization. We focus on cultures around the world, while also conducting leadership and service projects to help the community like the Taste of Mason.

name: Mason Speech & Debate Team
description: Mason Speech & Debate is a competitive academic organization at MHS that competes in various tournaments throughout the state. With 12 different events to choose from, everyone can find their niche within our team and compete in an event that suits their interest. Regardless of the event chosen, students will vastly increase their public speaking capabilities, confidence, and analytical thinking. Weekly tournaments throughout the winter build high team morale and a strong community of like-minded, passionate students.

name: Mason Hack Club
description:
Mason Hack Club is a computer programming club and is a chapter of the international Hack Club organization. We meet every Tuesday in room B109.

Our weekly meetings include a wide array of computer science topics for our members to explore and learn. These topics include cybersecurity, web design, database management, Raspberry Pi computing, and many, many more! Members of Mason Hack Club not only get to learn about amazing CS topics, but they also get to compete against their peers, connect with companies, volunteer for the community, and showcase their awesome projects.

Mason Hack Club's main goal is to help students of all ages learn about computer programming through teaching workshops and building a community where students can share their passion for coding.

Over the years, we've hosted and helped organize several events, such as our yearly coding camp for younger students named Mason Hack Camp, and hackathons like CincyHacks, CincyHacks Jr., and Hack Cincinnati. (Events are not set in stone due to the COVID-19 pandemic)

Mason Hack Club is sponsored by Cengage Learning.

name: MHS Math Team
description: At Math Team, we participate in a lot of challenging math competitions and sometimes go over the questions together. From time to time, we also put out our own problem sets over specific topics and discuss them together in a fun environment after school.

name: Blankets for Benefit
description: Blankets for Benefit is a club for anyone who wants to make a difference while having fun! We make fabric tie blankets and donate them to local hospitals, homeless shelters, and foster agencies. Help the community and have fun making blankets! No experience necessary and no mandatory meetings.

name: Women in STEM
description: MHS Women in STEM seeks to inspire young women to become leaders in the STEM community and to advocate for gender equality in STEM fields. We connect members with internships and summer programs, host guest speakers, and hold events that raise awareness of the gender inequalities within STEM fields. We also have opportunities for students to explore their unique interests and learn more about different fields of STEM.
sectionOneTitle: What does a typical meeting look like?
sectionOneContent: We will feature a different STEM career each meeting. Hopefully, these small snippets of STEM careers will help you find possible careers! We will also try to feature different college/summer STEM programs so members can get insight into possible opportunities they want to pursue. This club will also be an advocate for gender equality in the STEM industry. We will work as a club to speak out for change. Some meetings we will have a guest speaker to help members learn more about a certain career! We are open to all new ideas! We look forward to hearing member's ideas for the club!
sectionTwoContent: Join our schoology group using access code QV6G-F2P9-P93CW to stay up to date on upcoming meetings and events. Follow our club on Instagram @masonwomeninstem to stay connected with what our club is doing! Reach out to mhswomeninstem@gmail.com or DM us on Instagram if you have any questions about joining our club! We take members all year, so just look on schoology to see when our next meeting is, and show up!!

name: Model United Nations
description: Model UN is a club where students travel to colleges and compete against other high school students to speak, debate, and collaborate on a plethora of world issues. Such issues can range from nuclear disarmament, climate change, health crises, and even space races. Much like the actual UN, students work together to draft comprehensive resolutions that work to solve the issue at hand. Students who participate in this program become more comfortable with public speaking and sharing their ideas in larger groups, skills that stay with them throughout their lives.
sectionOneContent: Club members participate in many ways, and attending conferences is one of them. Modeled off of the United Nations, students from schools across the nation work with one another on addressing pressing issues at conferences, representing nations and individuals with differing viewpoints. Conferences are hosted by colleges and high schools both virtually and in person, and the club has attended conferences at the following colleges in the past: Indiana University, Ohio State University, UC Berkeley, Yale, Georgetown University, and American University. These conferences typically take place over multiple days, with multiple sessions devoted to tackling different topics under the larger structure of a single United Nations Committee or similar organizational body. After hours of fruitful debate and discussion, delegates vote on a comprehensive solution tailored to the topic that everyone participating agrees on, promoting amity, cooperation, and understanding between students.
sectionTwoContent: Every year, Model UN hosts a conference of their own! The 2021-2022 school year marks the seventh iteration of Mason High School’s conference, with WilmaMUN II, following the renaming of the conference during the 2019-2020 school year (formerly known as WMHSMUN). Club members take time to create committees on their own to run them for delegates from local high schools. Topics and content vary widely, emphasizing creativity and originality with past committees including: The Eagle And Dragon: War In The South China Sea, Operation Nowhere and Entree: Murder Mystery, and 2100, Turn of the Century: The Race to Relocate and Reallocate in Global Climate Catastrophe. Every member will have the opportunity to present an idea to be voted upon and selected by the club, so we’re looking forward to seeing your submissions this fall!
sectionThreeContent: Model UN is the definition of a student run organization. The seven member leadership team is elected by the club every spring in a comprehensive process designed to eliminate all possible bias. But leadership also extends beyond elected positions, with each and every member expected to lead from within. Whether it be in committee, where you may lead your bloc of like minded delegates to advocate for your solution, or in preparation for WilmaMUN where you may lead a team of fellow club members to create a committee to follow your vision. Leadership is essential in Model UN, no matter who you are.

name: Investment Club
description: Investment club provides financial and investment education to young people planning to start their journey in investing. Investment club covers topics such as fundamental analysis, technical analysis, and other strategies to help people become better investors. Investment club also has a branch dedicated to public speaking through their stock pitch competitions in which students have to choose a stock and present why it is a good buy to a panel of judges.

name: Writers' Block
description: Writers' Block is Mason High School's literary magazine.  It is published once each year in the spring and features writing and artwork from Mason students.  The goal of the club is to produce the magazine and highlight the artistic talents of our students.

name: SIBS - Students Involving & Befriending Students
description: SIBS is a group of carefully selected upperclassmen who provide mentoring to the freshmen class, and awareness of social isolation and inclusion.  The SIBS meet their assigned freshmen during a Freshmen Orientation Day, and about 4-5 SIBS are assigned to each freshmen homeroom.  The SIBS also welcome and tour new students, perform community service, and engage in events that promote inclusivity and combat social isolation.

name: MHS Varsity Dance Team
description: MHS Varsity Dance Team is a competitive dance team that competes regionally and nationally. Dance styles consist of jazz, hip hop, and pom.  The team performs at halftime basketball games, pep rallys, and community events.
advisorName: Christina Huetter, Holly Phelps, and Morgan Elam
